itemDescription: Scottish law lecturer, advocate, Unionist MP, Solicitor General for Scotland, and judge (1916-1995)

wikipedia_page.main: David Colville Anderson  (8 September 1916 – 31 December 1995) was a Scottish law lecturer, advocate, Unionist MP, Solicitor General for Scotland, and judge, whose career ended in a bizarre sexual scandal. Also a naval officer during World War II, Anderson was honoured by the Norwegian king for preventing a rumoured Soviet invasion.
